TC-001.Title: Verify SGP Generator Full Responsiveness on Desktop
TC-001.Dataset: No specific data required; use default SGP Generator interface.
TC-001.Preconditions: SGP Generator application is deployed and accessible via a supported desktop browser.

Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly at all common desktop resolutions.
Steps.Step Description: Open the SGP Generator application in a desktop web browser (e.g., Chrome, Firefox, Edge).
Steps.Step Expected Result: The application loads successfully without layout issues.

Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly at all common desktop resolutions.
Steps.Step Description: Resize the browser window to various widths (e.g., 1920px, 1366px, 1024px, 800px, 600px).
Steps.Step Expected Result: The layout and content adapt fluidly to each width, maintaining usability and readability.

Steps.Expected Result: SGP Generator displays and functions correctly at all common desktop resolutions.
Steps.Step Description: Interact with all primary features (e.g., navigation, form inputs, buttons) at each width.
Steps.Step Expected Result: All features remain accessible and functional at all tested widths.

TC-058.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only the scenario where all events expire within cache validity.

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Step Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Note the list of events displayed in the carousel, all with start date and time close to the current time.
Steps.Step Expected Result: All events are about to expire.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP (e.g., to another section of the app).
Steps.Step Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until all events' start date and time have passed, but remain within the cache validity period (X minutes).
Steps.Step Expected Result: All events are now expired, but cache is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Step Expected Result: Frontend detects all events are expired, triggers a new backend call, and displays new event cards. Cache timer is reset.

TC-059.Title: No Backend Call When At Least One Event Is Still Valid in Cache
TC-059.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with staggered start times.
TC-059.Partial Coverage Description: Does not cover cache expiration or all events expired scenarios.

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Step Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Note the list of events displayed, ensuring at least one event has a start date/time in the future and others are about to expire.
Steps.Step Expected Result: At least one event is still valid.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP.
Steps.Step Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until all but one event have expired, but remain within the cache validity period (X minutes).
Steps.Step Expected Result: Only one event remains valid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Step Expected Result: Frontend does not make a new backend call; carousel displays only the remaining valid event(s).

TC-060.Title: Expired Events Are Not Displayed After Cache Expiry and New Backend Call
TC-060.Dataset: User credentials; Event data with start times in the near future.
TC-060.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on cache expiration and backend refresh.

Steps.Step Description: Log in and navigate to the Home Page (HP).
Steps.Step Expected Result: User is on the HP and carousel displays event cards.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate away from the HP.
Steps.Step Expected Result: User leaves the HP.

Steps.Step Description: Wait until the cache expires (after X minutes).
Steps.Step Expected Result: Cache is now invalid.

Steps.Step Description: Return to the HP.
Steps.Step Expected Result: Frontend makes a new backend call and displays only non-expired events in the carousel.
